reviews.review_msg: Nadine is different as far as profs go, but she is extremely thoughtful and puts a lot of prep into her lectures.  Demands a lot of ingenuity  from students: a good experience if you have the time to put in.

How she ever got hired in the first place is beyond me.  Anytime a requisite assignment for a 3rd-year English course involves doing a collage, the red flags have to be waving immediately.  Easily the worst "professor" I've ever had.

Bizarro.  Spent half the semester speaking on the trials and tribulations of obtaining good office space within the English faculty.  Wrote a book and referenced it every 3.5 seconds in class.  Which, of course, had zero to do with Plato/critical theory.
